I was up late last night just sitting on the couch thinking about a lot of stuff and I thought about my great-grandmother who just recently passed away this last September. She had live to be almost 94 years old, being born in 1911. Since I've taken like 4 credits of history in High school already I'm amazed at how rapid technology has grown. We have gone from cart and buggy to drafting plans for hotels in space, Hilton/Ritz Carlton, a lunar base in works and deep space satellites. A new wave of technology is about to come out, nanotechnology, according to a friend of mine who is study in California right now and so much more. We can hold a Playstation in our hands which would have seemed ridiculous to anyone 20 years ago. I wonder how are lives will be in another 20 years, since the past 18 years of mine have been so dynamic. So this is just a ramble about the past and future I guess, what do you think we'll live to see? Such as the past decades saw us walk on the moon and so forth....
